poem:
Title: "An Ode to La Femme d'Argent"

Moonlight swayed in '98,
a symphony, sublime and late.
Now wakened notes of silver sound,
invite the dawn, the lost, the found.
In Paris, gasps play freedom's dance,
to the wild Air's striking, soft romance.
No chill-out mimic could dare smother,
the lambent beauty of no other.
It hums in hearts, on every street,
Moon Safari's eternal beat.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Air review – a wild, jawdropping, widescreen extravaganza The languid opening notes of La Femme d’Argent are a musical madeleine that elicits a collective gasp from the Coliseum. God only knows how many late nights and fuzzy dawns Air’s album Moon Safari soundtracked when it came out in 1998. It seemed to be everywhere, like an essential utility, and triggered a deluge of chill-out music, none of which could outdo the Parisian duo’s lambent beauty". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Air review – a wild, jawdropping, widescreen extravaganza The languid opening notes of La Femme d’Argent are a musical madeleine that elicits a collective gasp from the Coliseum. God only knows how many late nights and fuzzy dawns Air’s album Moon Safari soundtracked when it came out in 1998. It seemed to be everywhere, like an essential utility, and triggered a deluge of chill-out music, none of which could outdo the Parisian duo’s lambent beauty
